Description: Neck and shoulder fragment of Attic black-figured pottery column-krater. Outside, neck glazed; outlined tongues, alternating black and red, at top of shoulder. Below, perhaps an animal to right; red neck, tips of incised ears, and probably the tip of its tail are preserved. Interior glazed black with an added red line on the neck, just above the junction of neck and shoulder.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 75, no. 251 pl. 56)
Alexandridou 2011 / The Early Black-Figured Pottery of Attika in Context (c. 630-570BCE) (p. 123) (Naukratis 107)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0935)
